What law governs statutory vacation entitlement in Germany? The Federal Vacation Act (BUrlG) ensures every employee receives paid annual leave, regardless of full-time, part-time, or mini-job status.
description: legal basis of statutory vacation entitlement

content: How many days of statutory vacation are required each year? Employees working six days per week must receive at least 24 working days, while a five-day schedule equates to a minimum of 20 days, reflecting four weeks of paid leave.
How long can unused statutory vacation be carried over? Remaining statutory leave usually expires on 31 March of the following year unless special circumstances extend the deadline.

How is vacation entitlement calculated for different work schedules? The legal minimum equals four working weeks, so part-time staff receive a prorated number of days based on the days they actually work (e.g., three-day schedules earn twelve days).

What vacation do new hires receive during the first months? During the six-month waiting period, they accrue one-twelfth of their annual entitlement per full month worked and gain the full allotment once the period ends.

Is statutory vacation tied to an employee’s age? Only minors receive higher minimums under the Youth Employment Protection Act (e.g., 30 days before age 16), while adults share the same baseline and employers may voluntarily grant extra days to older staff.
What happens if an employee falls ill during approved vacation? They should obtain a medical certificate immediately and inform the employer so the affected days are restored to their balance.

How is unused vacation handled when employment ends? Depending on the termination date, remaining days must be granted or paid out, with partial entitlement applying before 30 June and the full amount after the waiting period is met.

Do employees have a statutory right to special leave for events like weddings or bereavements? Section 616 BGB allows paid absence for short, personal reasons, but granting special leave ultimately depends on employer discretion and any applicable collective agreements.

What statutory vacation entitlement applies in Germany? The Federal Vacation Act (BUrlG) guarantees employees at least four weeks of paid leave (24 working days in a six-day schedule or 20 in a five-day week), with part-time entitlements prorated. New hires accrue one twelfth of their allowance per completed month during the initial six-month waiting period, sick days with a medical certificate restore leave, unused days normally expire on 31 March of the following year, and any remaining leave at termination must be granted or paid out. Minors receive higher minima under the Youth Protection Act, while special leave for major life events remains at the employer's discretion.

How does the Federal Vacation Act help align company needs with employees' leave wishes? The BUrlG defines the minimum paid rest vacation for all workers and reminds HR to plan schedules that balance operational requirements with employees' preferred dates, ensuring employers and workers know their rights and duties.

How is the legal minimum vacation calculated for part-time employees? Use the formula (working days per week / 6) × 24 to scale the entitlement, so someone working three days weekly receives (3/6) × 24 = 12 paid vacation days each year.

How does vacation accrue during probation? Employers calculate vacation as (months worked / 12) × annual entitlement, so after three months with a 24-day entitlement the employee has (3/12) × 24 = 6 days, which grows to the full amount after six months.

Can collective agreements grant more vacation than the law? Yes, tariff or company agreements can provide extra days beyond the BUrlG minimum, and those negotiated values replace the statutory baseline for covered employees.

Do severely disabled employees receive extra vacation? Section 208 SGB I grants five additional paid days annually, adjusted according to their weekly schedule, and any other agreements that award even more time remain valid.

What happens to remaining vacation when employment ends? Employers must allow the use of accrued days during the notice period unless operational needs prevent it, in which case the remaining vacation is paid out; partial totals use prorated math for first-half resignations and full entitlement after six months or during the second half of the year.

How is vacation pay computed under the BUrlG? Employers calculate Urlaubsentgelt using the average earnings from the 13 weeks before vacation starts so employees keep their usual income during leave; it is not an extra bonus but ensures financial stability while resting.

What rights exist for consecutive vacation? According to § 7 Abs. 2 BUrlG employees can request at least 12 continuous days, and employers may only refuse for urgent business reasons or if another employee has precedence for social reasons such as school holidays.

Can leftover vacation be carried over? Leave normally expires at year end, but employers must warn workers, highlight pending days, and encourage taking them; only after proper notice can unused time be pushed into the next year per the 2022 BAG ruling.

Is unpaid leave supported by law? There is no automatic right, but § 616 BGB allows short periods off for personal reasons without fault, and employers may also grant unpaid leave for other events out of care, typically regulated in collective agreements.

Can employees apply for sabbaticals or long-term unpaid leave? Such arrangements are not guaranteed by law but can be created through company or tariff agreements, and structured programs help employees plan extended breaks with mutual commitments.
